title: Nigeria ethnic identity vs  Mexico nationalism

content.question: Mexican political culture differs from Nigerian political culture in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Mexicans have historically supported military intervention in politics, while Nigerians have violently protested military rule.
Mexicans have a strong sense of national identity, while Nigerians identify more strongly with their individual ethnic group.
Mexicans strongly approve of authoritarian leadership, while Nigerians approve of democratic leadership.
In Mexico gender equality is an important political norm, while in Nigeria women are seen as politically inferior.
In Nigeria individual liberty is valued over the communityâ€™s welfare, while in Mexico limits on individual liberty are widely supported.

content.answer: Mexicans have a strong sense of national identity, while Nigerians identify more strongly with their individual ethnic group.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
